name: murkily
content:
murkily adverb
(DARKLY/DIRTILY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is dark and dirty or difficult to see through: The photos in the book have been murkily reproduced. We had our dinner in a murkily lit restaurant.
More examplesFewer examplesThe drink was muddy brown in colour and murkily opaque.Dawn was breaking murkily over the town.

murkily adverb
(UNPLEASANTLY)
in a way that is complicated and unpleasant and in which many facts are not clear: What the council plan to do with the money remains murkily undisclosed. He was accused of using his murkily obtained fortune to influence politicians.
More examplesFewer examplesThe spies worked in a murkily and morally ambiguous world.
